metadata.Title: CVE-2022-40982 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
Information exposure through microarchitectural state after transientexecution in certain vector execution units for some Intel(R) Processorsmay allow an authenticated user to potentially enable informationdisclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-40982` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

intel-microcode - 3.20230808.0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic - 5.15.0-82.91
linux-image-5.15.0-82-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-82.91

criterions.comment: intel-microcode package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.20230808.0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-82.91').
linux-hwe-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
linux-kvm package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-1040.45').
linux-allwinner-5.19: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
